The 'Natural Resources Defense Council' ('NRDC') is a New York City-based, non-
profit, non-partisan international environmental advocacy group, with offices in
Washington, D.C., San Francisco, Los Angeles, Chicago, and Beijing. Founded in
1970, NRDC today has 1.3 million members and online activists nationwide and a
staff of more than 400 lawyers, scientists and other policy experts.

[[Worth (magazine)|Worth]] magazine has named NRDC one of America's 100 best
charities, Charity Navigator has given NRDC four out of four
stars as of
2007, [http://charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=search.summary&orgid=4207
Charity Navigator] and the Wise Giving Alliance of the Better Business
Bureau reports that NRDC meets its highest standards for accountability and use
of donor funds. http://www.nrdc.org/about/who_we_are.asp The New York
Times calls NRDC "One of the nation's most powerful environmental groups." The
National Journal says NRDC is "A credible and forceful advocate for stringent
environmental protection."
categories: Environmental organizations based in the United States
